where y was the individual dependent variable (n = 14); μ was the average of all observations; α was the fixed effect of treatment ( i = 1 to 7); and ε ij was the random residual error, assumed to be independent and N(0, σ 2).
(3) \documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{upgreek} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document} }{}\begin{eqnarray*} {y_{ijk}} = \mu + {\alpha _i} + {\beta _j} + {(\alpha \beta )_{ij}} + {\varepsilon _{ijk}} \end{eqnarray*}\end{document}
